content:
• Tuesday, December 13, 2011
  • PCG

    Pacific Gas and Electric (NYSE:PCG) says it is liable for the 2010 fatal natural gas pipeline...

    Pacific Gas and Electric (NYSE:PCG) says it is liable for the 2010 fatal natural gas pipeline accident in San Bruno, Calif., meaning PG&E will take financial responsibility to compensate all victims for injuries suffered as a result of the accident. PCG -1.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • AVP

    Avon Products (NYSE:AVP) gains 5.3% AH after announcing it will split its Chairman and CEO...

    Avon Products (NYSE:AVP) gains 5.3% AH after announcing it will split its Chairman and CEO roles. Andrea Jung, who currently holds both titles, will be named Executive Chairman, and the company will "undertake an external search" to find a new CEO. Avon shares have been battered this year by weak earnings and an SEC probe, with the decline leading some to view it as an acquisition target.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM | 4 Comments
  • ABM

    ABM Industries (NYSE:ABM), a provider of facility staffing services, drops 4.7% AH after...

    ABM Industries (NYSE:ABM), a provider of facility staffing services, drops 4.7% AH after delivering its FQ4 report. EPS of $0.37 beat by a penny, and revenue of $1.08B (+20% Y/Y) was in-line. However, the company is guiding for FY12 EPS of $1.40-$1.50, a range that's largely below a $1.49 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • ESRX

    Also helping to pound Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) shares, -3.1% AH, is the disclosure that...

    Also helping to pound Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) shares, -3.1% AH, is the disclosure that it’s locked in a contract dispute with WellPoint (WLP), and the companies may go to court and fight it out. Express Scripts previously has said that WellPoint represented nearly 30% of its revenue for the nine months ended Sept. 30. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • ESRX

    NY Governor Andrew Cuomo signs legislation limiting the ability of PBMs such as Express Script...

    NY Governor Andrew Cuomo signs legislation limiting the ability of PBMs such as Express Script (NASDAQ:ESRX) and Medco Health (NYSE:MHS) to guide prescriptions to mail-order pharmacies. The bill marks a victory for retail pharmacies desperate to hold on to market share with health plans. Lower on the news in AH trading: ESRX -3.7%, MHS -1.8%. Getting a lift: WAG +1%, CVS +0.7%, RAD +0.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • LNG

    Midstream natural gas concern Cheniere Energy (LNG -7%), which had already given back Monday's...

    Midstream natural gas concern Cheniere Energy (LNG -7%), which had already given back Monday's gains in today's trading, drops 10.2% AH after announcing it will issue 33M shares. Cheniere plans to use the proceeeds for "general corporate purposes, including repayment of indebtedness." The company had $2.47B in long-term debt on its balance sheet as of Sep. 30.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • FORM

    Chip equipment maker FormFactor (NASDAQ:FORM) drops 8% AH after warning it expects Q4 revenue of...

    Chip equipment maker FormFactor (NASDAQ:FORM) drops 8% AH after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $28M-$31M, below prior guidance of $30M-$34M, and much lower than the $43.9M reported in the year-ago period. The company claims industry conditions, which were weak to begin with, "have further deteriorated over the last two months."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • CCOI

    Cogent Communications (CCOI -1.8%) finishes the day lower after Citigroup cut the shares to...

    Cogent Communications (CCOI -1.8%) finishes the day lower after Citigroup cut the shares to Neutral from Buy on valuation. The stock has been a powerhouse performer during the recent fall rally, up over 45% since mid-September.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • RLD

    RealD (RLD -4%) trades near its year low after Barrington Research downgrades the stock to...

    RealD (RLD -4%) trades near its year low after Barrington Research downgrades the stock to Market Perform on valuation, citing a lack of near-term catalysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • NSC

    Norfolk Southern (NSC -2.4%) dips after RBC cut the shares to Sector Perform earlier today,...

    Norfolk Southern (NSC -2.4%) dips after RBC cut the shares to Sector Perform earlier today, citing its valuation relative to its peers. The stock has been a solid performer as of late, gaining over 25% since early October.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • GLD

    The selloff in gold accelerates after the Fed delivers no new candy in its policy statement, the...

    The selloff in gold accelerates after the Fed delivers no new candy in its policy statement, the metal falling nearly 2% since 2:15. At $1,638/oz., gold is at its lowest level since mid-October, when it briefly dipped below $1,600. GLD -2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • LRN

    A NYT report focused primarily on online education services provider K12 (LRN -18.2%) paints the...

    A NYT report focused primarily on online education services provider K12 (LRN -18.2%) paints the company in a harsh light: "A portrait emerges of a company that tries to squeeze profits from public school dollars by raising enrollment, increasing teacher workload and lowering standards." Shares of for-profit educators also sink: DV -2.9%, STRA -4.3%, BPI -3%, CECO -5.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • LIVE

    Microcap B2B facilitator LiveDeal (NASDAQ:LIVE) is the days biggest mover, soaring over 300% on...

    Microcap B2B facilitator LiveDeal (NASDAQ:LIVE) is the days biggest mover, soaring over 300% on 460 times its average daily volume after the company completed an equity financing with five unaffiliated investors for an aggregate cash purchase price of $2M and issued a total of 1,612,899 new shares at $1.24 per share. The additional financing allows the company to retain its Nasdaq listing.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • FDS

    FactSet Research (FDS -8.3%) sinks after the financial software firm projects EPS above analyst...

    FactSet Research (FDS -8.3%) sinks after the financial software firm projects EPS above analyst consensus for the current quarter but revenue slightly below Street estimates. FQ1 earnings rose 9.4%, helped by higher revenue and client growth, though recent volatility in financial markets interrupted buying patterns from some clients.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) reported interest in acquiring flash memory controller vendor Anobit is...

    Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) reported interest in acquiring flash memory controller vendor Anobit is giving a lift to solid-state drive makers OCZ (OCZ +2.7%) and STEC (STEC +6.6%). Sandisk (SNDK +1.1%) is also up, though Anobit's chips indirectly compete with Sandisk's controllers, which tend to be bundled with its flash memory. Bernstein sees Apple's rumored move as an attempt to turn flash vendors into mere suppliers of commodity chips.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • PCYC

    Shares of Pharmacyclics (PCYC +9%) jump higher today after Wedbush adds it to its "Best Ideas"...

    Shares of Pharmacyclics (PCYC +9%) jump higher today after Wedbush adds it to its "Best Ideas" list and raises its price target from $17 to $25. Wedbush says the stock should outperform over the next 12 months as the company rolls out its new drug, PCI-32765.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • JPM

    JPMorgan (JPM -1.8%) is selling off after Bloomberg reports the firm's lending to MF Global will...

    JPMorgan (JPM -1.8%) is selling off after Bloomberg reports the firm's lending to MF Global will be probed by regulators.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 4 Comments
  • IDT

    IDT (IDT -16.8%) gets hammered after announcing plans to slash its quarterly dividend by 43% to...

    IDT (IDT -16.8%) gets hammered after announcing plans to slash its quarterly dividend by 43% to $0.13 a share
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -10.4%) is off sharply today, giving back a large chunk of its...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -10.4%) is off sharply today, giving back a large chunk of its post-crash gains. The culprit may be Symphony/IRI data claiming the market share and average selling price of Green Mountain's K-Cups fell in November. However, the declines are modest in scope.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 4 Comments
  • BG

    Bunge (BG -8%) takes a hit after Goldman initiates the shares with a Sell rating, saying soybean...

    Bunge (BG -8%) takes a hit after Goldman initiates the shares with a Sell rating, saying soybean crush margins, a key part of its business, are being adversely impacted by a number of factors including a contracting chicken industry, weak demand and a scarcity of supply.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • OLED

    Shares of Universal Panel (PANL -3.3%) trade lower, weighed down with a negative report...

    Shares of Universal Panel (PANL -3.3%) trade lower, weighed down with a negative report filtering out from The Street Sweeper alleging the firm is engaging in a kind of patent shell game along with a laundry list of other complaints already brought up in an October version of the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • RVSN

    RADVision (RVSN +16%) shares spike following a report the Israeli videoconferencing company is...

    RADVision (RVSN +16%) shares spike following a report the Israeli videoconferencing company is in "advanced talks" to be acquired. RADV has been struggling and reportedly looking for a buyer since Cisco acquired rival Tandberg for $3.3B in 2009; the company was in talks to be acquired by H-P last year but talks broke down over price.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • ENZ

    Enzo Biochem (ENZ -9.3%) takes a hit after its FQ1 misses across the board. Net losses widened...

    Enzo Biochem (ENZ -9.3%) takes a hit after its FQ1 misses across the board. Net losses widened Y/Y, as royalty payments declined and operating expenses jumped 11% due to higher SG&A expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • WDFC

    WD-40 (WDFC +2%) moves up after its board approves a $50M share buyback plus a 7% boost in its...

    WD-40 (WDFC +2%) moves up after its board approves a $50M share buyback plus a 7% boost in its quarterly dividend to $0.29 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • URBN

    Oppenheimer takes a hard look at Urban Outfitters (URBN +5.4%) in the wake of the firm's release...

    Oppenheimer takes a hard look at Urban Outfitters (URBN +5.4%) in the wake of the firm's release of an estimates for Q4 same-store sales. Analysts tell clients in a note that their $35 price target on URBN factors in a 22X multiple on a forward EPS estimate of $1.59, justifying the premium valuation on the strength of the retailer's "unique brand/product positioning and multiple growth vehicles."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC Electronic (WFR -2.2%) dips after Standard & Poor's puts its junk-grade credit status...

    MEMC Electronic (WFR -2.2%) dips after Standard & Poor's puts its junk-grade credit status on watch for a possible downgrade, citing a number of risks posed by the company's exposure to the oversupplied solar-energy sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • GILD

    Shares of YM Biosciences (YMI +16.1%) fall back to earth a bit after surging over 20% in AH and...

    Shares of YM Biosciences (YMI +16.1%) fall back to earth a bit after surging over 20% in AH and premarket trading on positive results on testing of its CYT387 drug. Rodman & Renshaw's Reni Benjamin says the big takeaway from the data is that it meets the threshold of attracting interest from other companies looking to partner.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • WCRX

    Warner Chilcott (WCRX -0.9%) says a federal appeals court has vacated a lower court's ruling...

    Warner Chilcott (WCRX -0.9%) says a federal appeals court has vacated a lower court's ruling that would have prevented Mylan (MYL +0.6%) from releasing a generic version of its Doryx acne drug until pending patent litigation was decided. The company says it will still vigorously defend its Doryx patent and intends to seek a new restraining order from the district court.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • PLT

    Plantronics (PLT -1.1%) takes a quick dive in the wake of the NTSB's recommendation to ban all...

    Plantronics (PLT -1.1%) takes a quick dive in the wake of the NTSB's recommendation to ban all portable electronics devices from cars. The company is the major maker of telephone headset systems.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • ROYL

    Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL -0.8%) gives back all of its 9% early morning gain and now trades in...

    Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL -0.8%) gives back all of its 9% early morning gain and now trades in negative territory, following the announcement that it's acquired more than 100K acres in the "heart of the oil window" during the state of Alaska's North Slope lease sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • BB

    RIM (RIMM) -3.8% at 15.59 after touching a fresh 52-week low of $15.48. This follows more pot...

    RIM (RIMM) -3.8% at 15.59 after touching a fresh 52-week low of $15.48. This follows more pot shots from analysts, including from JP Morgan and William Blair, with even the usually positive Scotia Capital saying management needs help. MS expects grim numbers when RIM reports earnings on Thursday.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN +2.79%) ekes out a small gain after giving back much of an early...

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN +2.79%) ekes out a small gain after giving back much of an early morning pop after Ticonderoga ups the shares to Neutral on valuation, citing industry checks that point to stabilizing sapphire wafer prices by early 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • SSW

    In addition to the earlier announcement of its tender-offer, Seaspan (SSW +19.9%) also says it's...

    In addition to the earlier announcement of its tender-offer, Seaspan (SSW +19.9%) also says it's acquiring Seaspan Management Services Limited for $54M in an all stock transaction.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • CXW

    Corrections (CXW +2%) gains on an upgrade to Overweight from Equalweight at Barclays, citing the...

    Corrections (CXW +2%) gains on an upgrade to Overweight from Equalweight at Barclays, citing the company's flexibility and attractive leverage relative to its peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • INTC

    Intel (INTC -1.5%) adds to losses following yesterday's cut in Q4 guidance. Susquehanna keeps a...

    Intel (INTC -1.5%) adds to losses following yesterday's cut in Q4 guidance. Susquehanna keeps a Neutral rating on shares: “We think the pre-announcement is a good step toward resetting expectations... [it] opens considerable uncertainty regarding the impact to the first quarter, and we believe it would be difficult for the stock to perform well until that uncertainty is resolved."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • MAS

    Masco (MAS +1%) remains in positive territory, despite giving back much of its opening pop on a...

    Masco (MAS +1%) remains in positive territory, despite giving back much of its opening pop on a Goldman upgrade to Neutral. The firm says the building-products maker is in the early stages of rebuilding its cost structure and that FY12 consensus estimates are much more achievable than previously forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • CMEDQ

    Shares of China Medical (CMED -14.6%) fall steeply after the firm says it will implement debt...

    Shares of China Medical (CMED -14.6%) fall steeply after the firm says it will implement debt restructuring with new rates and terms for holders. The story at CMED continues to get grimmer with fraud allegations lingering and shares now off over 75% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +6.7%) shares are surging today on no apparent news, except perhaps this:...

    Groupon (GRPN +6.7%) shares are surging today on no apparent news, except perhaps this: Tomorrow, the underwriters who led Groupon’s IPO are unleashed from the 40-day quiet period on stock research, and traders may be buying before the first reports hit the tape. When the research gates opened on LinkedIn’s IPO, all the underwriting banks issued - surprise! - buy ratings on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 5 Comments
  • P

    Pandora (P +5.5%) shares surge on news the company's service enjoyed increased listenership of...

    Pandora (P +5.5%) shares surge on news the company's service enjoyed increased listenership of 13%-25% in the 10 largest U.S. radio markets during November, including a 25% gain in the NYC metro area. Its weekly cumulative audience among adults age 18-49 included 1M-plus unique listeners in each of the top two markets, NY and LA.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • DXR

    Medical instrumentation and biotechnology company Daxor (DXR +2.4%) gains after saying it's...

    Medical instrumentation and biotechnology company Daxor (DXR +2.4%) gains after saying it's received a trial agreement from the Washington, DC VA Medical Center.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • CRM

    Shares of Salesforce.com (CRM -1.1%) continue to slide from yesterday’s downgrade by Cowen...

    Shares of Salesforce.com (CRM -1.1%) continue to slide from yesterday’s downgrade by Cowen on slowing billings, even as some bulls come to the stock’s defense. Salesforce execs tell Citi's Walter Pritchard there’s been no “top down” change to invoicing practices, and an informal poll of customers shows they’re not seeing any sudden change in the way they’re billed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • TRQ

    Execs with Ivanhoe Mining (IVN -15.5%) say the firm is evaluating legal options following its...

    Execs with Ivanhoe Mining (IVN -15.5%) say the firm is evaluating legal options following its courtroom battle loss to keep a poison pill in place in its bid to stave off Rio Tinto (RIO +0.8%) from acquiring the company. Rio's maximum permitted interest in Ivanhoe is capped at 49% until Jan. 18, 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 3 Comments
  • ESIO

    Electro Scientific Industries (ESIO +3.3%) gets a bump higher after its board authorizes a...

    Electro Scientific Industries (ESIO +3.3%) gets a bump higher after its board authorizes a quarterly cash dividend of $0.08 per share and a $20M stock buyback. The announcement comes as a relief after the company, which supplies laser-based manufacturing solutions for the microtechnology industry, reported a big drop in orders that warned of lean times to come over the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • TOL

    Toll Brothers (TOL -2.9%) slides for a second straight day as Citigroup downgrades the...

    Toll Brothers (TOL -2.9%) slides for a second straight day as Citigroup downgrades the homebuilder to Neutral, based primarily on valuation after shares have risen 18% in the past five weeks. Yesterday, KeyBanc cut TOL and Lennar (LEN -1.2%) to Hold, finding the stocks "best in class" but with "unwarranted" optimism tied to the spring trade and positive housing data.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • JIVE

    Jive Software (NASDAQ:JIVE) makes its first prints, trading at $15.10, +25.8% from its $12 IPO...

    Jive Software (NASDAQ:JIVE) makes its first prints, trading at $15.10, +25.8% from its $12 IPO price. The company's valuation is now more than $800M. Jive lost $38.1M on revenues of $54.8M through the first 9 months of 2011. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • CCMP

    Chip equipment maker Cabot Microelectronics (CCMP +17.7%) skyrockets after announcing it plans...

    Chip equipment maker Cabot Microelectronics (CCMP +17.7%) skyrockets after announcing it plans to pay a $15/share special dividend in Q1. In a move that would likely make Whitney Tilson smile, the company says half of the dividend's cost will be paid for by issuing debt. Cabot also says it's boosting the size of its stock buyback program to $150M, from a prior level of $83M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • TRTN

    TAL International Group (TAL +4.9%) registers a solid gain after Nomura initiates coverage with...

    TAL International Group (TAL +4.9%) registers a solid gain after Nomura initiates coverage with a Buy rating. The stock has been hitting the radar of a lot of dividend screens lately with its lush 7.5% yield.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM

  • Iran says the Strait of Hormuz is not shut, Bloomberg reports (via Zero Hedge). Crude futures...

    Iran says the Strait of Hormuz is not shut, Bloomberg reports (via Zero Hedge). Crude futures give back some of their gains and fall below $100 to $99.69. That's +2% for the day. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 3 Comments
  • IDA

    Idacorp (IDA +1.7%) moves up on an upgrade to Buy at Ladenburg Thalmann, citing the company's...

    Idacorp (IDA +1.7%) moves up on an upgrade to Buy at Ladenburg Thalmann, citing the company's settlement stipulation with one of its key customers on its equity sharing arrangements. With the agreement in place, the power supplier says it expects to initiate a significant increase to its dividend in FY12.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • DENN

    Denny's (DENN +4.3%) shares rally after CEO John Miller discloses purchasing 100,000 shares of...

    Denny's (DENN +4.3%) shares rally after CEO John Miller discloses purchasing 100,000 shares of his company's stock, or $339,010 worth, on Dec. 9, according to an SEC filing, after having owned almost no company stock previously.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • BBY

    Deutsche Bank reduces its rating on Best Buy (BBY -11.4%) to Hold, troubled by disappointing...

    Deutsche Bank reduces its rating on Best Buy (BBY -11.4%) to Hold, troubled by disappointing margins: Q3 "hammers home the point that BBY may be able to drive a comp, but will have a difficult time maintaining profit levels to do it as they fight back against newer competitors for share." BBY must "figure out a way to win back share without sacrificing profits.”

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 2 Comments
  • MUR

    Deutsche is taking a bullish stance on the oil sector over the next year as demand continues to...

    Deutsche is taking a bullish stance on the oil sector over the next year as demand continues to outpace supply. The firm upgrades the following drillers to Buy, citing their leverage to higher oil prices: Murphy Oil (MUR +2.9%), Hess (HES +2.5%) and Marathon Oil (MRO +3.2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • BA

    A press conference in Dallas with execs from Boeing (BA +2.2%) and Southwest Airlines (LUV...

    A press conference in Dallas with execs from Boeing (BA +2.2%) and Southwest Airlines (LUV +0.9%) over their blockbuster 737 MAX deal just concluded as the firms keep the LUV-fest between the two firms percolating. Highlights from Southwest CEO Gary Kelly: "One of the main challenges we face are high fuel costs and we are very much in need of new technology to reduce the fuel burn...for the near term we are not changing our fleet strategy...we will have flexibility in the future to manage our retirements and options that we can grow our fleet."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • FNGN

    Financial Engines (FNGN +5.5%) moves higher after catching the eye of analysts at Needham who...

    Financial Engines (FNGN +5.5%) moves higher after catching the eye of analysts at Needham who fire up a Buy rating and $26 price target on shares. "The market opportunity is large and underserved, with favorable demographic trends, legislative and regulatory tailwinds, and an increased demand for advice in the workplace should lead to open ended growth for FNGN."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • SSW

    Seaspan (SSW +18.5%) catches a bid after offering to tender 10M shares of common stock at a...

    Seaspan (SSW +18.5%) catches a bid after offering to tender 10M shares of common stock at a price of $15/share. Directors and execs say they will sit out the tender offer and hold on to their own shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • PVAC

    Oil-and-gas explorer Penn Virginia (PVA -2%) lowers its production guidance for Q4, citing the...

    Oil-and-gas explorer Penn Virginia (PVA -2%) lowers its production guidance for Q4, citing the timing of its Eagle Ford Shale projects and a revision in the method it uses for estimating production from its Eagle Ford wells. It now expects between 10.7 bcfe to 11 bcfe, down from earlier estimates of around 12.2 Bcfe to 12.7 Bcfe.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • PTRY

    Southern convenience store and gas station chain The Pantry (PTRY -12.6%) sells off after...

    Southern convenience store and gas station chain The Pantry (PTRY -12.6%) sells off after reporting FQ4 revenue of $2.18B (+12% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.37, missing consensus estimates by $30M and $0.22. Same-store merchandise sales fell 0.8% Y/Y, while same-store gas volumes fell 8.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • ECYT

    It's a bloodbath for shares of Endocyte (ECYT -61%) after analysis of trials on its Precedent...

    It's a bloodbath for shares of Endocyte (ECYT -61%) after analysis of trials on its Precedent cancer treatment tips off that early conditional approval in the EU appears less certain now. Baird downgrades the company to Neutral, saying "stepping to the sidelines for now makes the most sense."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 1 Comment

  • Crude oil spikes $2 in minutes to $100.45/barrel on a report Iran has closed the Strait of...

    Crude oil spikes $2 in minutes to $100.45/barrel on a report Iran has closed the Strait of Hormuz "until further notice," for a military exercise. "We will hold an exercise to close the Strait of Hormuz in the near future," says an Iranian official in today's Tehran Times. "If the world wants to make the region insecure, we will make the world insecure."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 4 Comments
  • BBY

    Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) weak FQ3 report (I, II) is taking a toll on fellow electronic retailers...

    Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) weak FQ3 report (I, II) is taking a toll on fellow electronic retailers hhgregg (HGG -4.8%), RadioShack (RSH -2.3%), and Aaron's (AAN -0.7%). Meanwhile, soft retail sales data is leading the likes of Wal-Mart (WMT -0.1%) and Macy's (M -0.7%) to underperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMCN

    Chinese travel ad network AirMedia Group (AMCN +3.5%) trades higher after guiding for Q4 revenue...

    Chinese travel ad network AirMedia Group (AMCN +3.5%) trades higher after guiding for Q4 revenue of $84M-$86M, above the company's prior guidance range of $79M-$81M, as well as a $78.4M consensus. The company attributes the guidance hike to stronger-than-expected advertising demand, along with a weaker-than-expected impact from Thai flooding.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • MRT-OLD

    Piper Jaffray keeps its Overweight rating and juicy $9 price target in place on shares of...

    Piper Jaffray keeps its Overweight rating and juicy $9 price target in place on shares of Morton's Restaurant Group (MRT-OLD +0.5%). Analysts with the firm cite ongoing risks for the company as the variable market for beef and its ability to hold onto talented employees.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • NES

    Heckmann (HEK +2.7%) shares spike at the open on takeover speculation. Analysts say Heckmann,...

    Heckmann (HEK +2.7%) shares spike at the open on takeover speculation. Analysts say Heckmann, which supplies workers and equipment to handle the chemical-tainted water that is a byproduct of fracking, may attract interest from Halliburton, Schlumberger or other oilfield services suppliers, but CEO Richard Heckmann says the company is not for sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 16 Comments
  • NDRO-OLD

    Enduro Royalty Trust (NYSE:NDRO-OLD) gains 1.6% after Goldman starts coverage with a Buy and $24...

    Enduro Royalty Trust (NYSE:NDRO-OLD) gains 1.6% after Goldman starts coverage with a Buy and $24 PT.     Diversified medical products giant Baxter (NYSE:BAX) announces it's acquiring surgical device maker Synovis (NASDAQ:SYNO) for $28/share, or $260M after adjusting for net cash. The price represents a 52% premium to Synovis' Monday close. Baxter expects the deal, which is expected to close in Q1, will be dilutive to its 2012 EPS by $0.04, but will be neutral to 2013 EPS, and accretive afterwards.
